passage_text: Jute is the name of the plant or fiber that is used to make burlap, Hessian or gunny cloth. The word 'jute' is probably coined from the word jhuta or jota, an Oriya word. Hessian /ˈhɛsi.ən/ , or burlap in the US and Canada, is a woven fabric usually made from skin of the jute plant or sisal fibres, or may be combined with other vegetable fibres to make rope, nets, and similar products.
